title: Great port
comment: No compatability issues found so far by me.   Shame that right click seems ineffective on USB connected mouse (although multi-touch tablets can use right click by holding one finger on the screen and tapping with another), though I may be wrong about that. Lack of ability to save certain games quickly as easily is where it loses its fifth star. Can change the options to autosave at set intervals, but option doesn't stick from one use to the next so you have to do it each time.        To change to touchscreen controls go to settings, midi, check the mixed AdLib box. Then quit and reopen.

comment: Go to the MIDI tab in the options and select "mixed AdLib/midi mode" and restart the emu. It's a weird workaround for android. You are welcome! This here is one FANTASTIC emulator.

title: Great app
comment: This is a great app for playing classic point and click adventures. The best emulator on the Google Play Store. By default, direct touch mode is turned off and its not apparent how to turn it on.  Go to 'options' then 'midi' and make sure 'mixed adlib/midi mode' is checked then restart Scummvm and direct touch should be enabled.

For example, I can't just activate a menu item or in-game object by directly clicking on it via the touchscreen. You'll need to download the correct plugins to add support for certain games or series.  I suggest you only download the ones you plan to actually use.  If you add more games later, then download the appropriate plugins as you need them.

title: It works - but frustrating if you are accustomed to a touch screen.
comment: It does does what it says it should do - and it's wonderful that the authors do this for free  but the interface is awkward to use.  It's not really a touch screen interface, it's more like an emulated mouse - so you can't just click on an area on the screen and expect to generate a mouse click there.  You have to center on the cursor, then drag that cursor over to where you want it to be, then click.  It might be that the authors had to do it this way for some unforeseen reason - but it seems like it would be much more fluid if it actually acted like a touch screen app.  I've only played Loom on it and it played as it should.

title: Kind of clunky
comment: It feels too much like the original PC version hastily thrown into an Android port with no effort to actually make a true port.  For example, the mouse has sensitivity and acceleration settings that just don't feel right at all (too low sensitivity, too high acceleration.  But it depends on the screen size among other things and REALLY needs to be adjustable as the same settings don't work on all devices.  Tablets -- which is where ScummVM makes the most sense anyway -- in particular probably need a higher sensitivity and lower acceleration.)  Switching between touchscreen and touchpad mode requires that you change the MIDI setting which obviously makes no sense, but some games (Lands of Lore for instance) really need touchscreen mode, and, dragging a mouse cursor around is slow and tedious.  I also wish it supported portrait mode (yes, I realize you'd have a lot of blank space and the overall size would be smaller, but at times it would be a lot more comfortable and convenient -- especially when holding a tablet.)  I think it should default to touchscreen and actually even support zooming for those pixel hunts too.  Overall it needs a lot of work IMO, but it is at least a start.

La possibilité de mapper la souris et les touches du clavier sur des raccourcis serait grandement apprécié!  Pour faire fonctionner davantage de jeux dos avec une possibilité de configuration des touches, il faut choisir le logiciel dosbox tournant le mieux sur votre mobile, cependant les jeux sont moins simple à installer dessus.

title: unique doesn't mean good
comment: All these five-star reviews come from people who are just happy to play their good old adventure games. As much happy as I am, lets be honest: the user interface is bad. Designed for a desktop computer, it doesn't use possibilities offered by touchscreens. How about sliding from left to open the inventory? Also, as mentioned by others, action sequences in Full Throttle are almost impossible to complete. I recall that the WM version of ScummVM had an option to skip action sequences for FT.

title: A lot of potential...
comment: I was really excited about the prospect of point-and-click adventure classics on my tablet, but this version of ScummVM is still a little rough around the edges. It's most glaring flaw is a lack of control customization. The trackpad-like controls work alright, but why isn't there an option to increase the cursor sensitivity? It's so painfully slow for my tastes. I'd also really like to see touch-to-click controls in some form. They worked out pretty alright in the Nintendo DS version, afterall, and that's on a tiny screen. Other than that, the compatibility seems to be great. The games are running really nice and smooth.  I'm uninstalling the app for now, but I look forward to future improvements!

title: great compatibility
comment: touch screen devices are arguably the best devices for playing old school adventure games. this android version of scummvm works well; just copy your game files to your SD card and point the app to that directory (but make sure you have the relevant plugin in order to boot them). the text on the new interface is too small on my 3.2 inch screen but that's the only problem. once games load they run perfectly. for those struggling with cursor navigation, enable 'mixed adbli/midi mode' in the midi options for direct touch input. edit: wish there was a way to leave games running in the background when you press 'home.' i get a black screen when i try to re-open scumm after pressing home.

title: Amazing app!  Great classic games!
comment: Out of all the games that have been released for Android, I find myself mostly returning to my SNES emulator and SCUMMVM!  Playing these classic game tickles my nostalgia button like nothing else can.   Tip for those not happy with the controls:  on the main menu go into OPTIONS > MIDI tab and then tap the "Mixed Adlib/MIDI mode".  Exit the app and launch it again.  This option changes the controls from touchpad-like to direct input.  I personally prefer this mode.  The only thing I'd wish they'd change is an option to make the font and button size larger on the main screen, as it's hard to select the small buttons with my chubby fingers.  AWESOME APP!!!
